name: John Hardy Workshop & Kapal Bamboo Boutique at Mambal
address: PT. Kapal Bambu Perhiasan, Jl. Raya Mambal Br. Baturning No.1, Mambal, Kec. Abiansemal, Kabupaten Badung, Bali 80352, Indonesia
review 1:
We stumbled upon this place while staying in a villa just around the corner. If you happen to be around the area I recommend taking the time to visit this beautiful place - if not for the jewelry it is worth the visit for the wonderfully constructed buildings and the nice garden!
We were greeted with a cool welcome drink and got an introduction in the history of the brand as well as an explanation of all the products. I ended up getting a bracelet as a nice daily reminder of the good time we had during our vacation on the island üòÄ
review 2: As a long time John Hardy fan, I was so excited to learn that we could visit the workshop and showroom while here in Bali. We were greeted with a welcome drink and were shown a short video. Then we were able to see a bit of what goes into making a classic John Hardy piece. John Hardy and his group of artisans are passionate about preserving the Bali lifestyle and traditions. It is reflected both in the jewelry design and in their effort to preserve the landscape and give back. Purchasing a piece from their bamboo collection plants a bamboo tree. The landscape around the workshop is beautiful and delicate, as are the staff working here; kind and helpful. I‚Äôd recommend stopping by if you are in the area.
review 3: We came without a booking and were very lucky there was no-one booked in to visit the workshop at the same time. They provided us a wonderful  guide - Putri, who took us on a very interesting and informative walk around their workshop and boutique. She had excellent English, was very erudite and interesting to speak with. The experience was short and sweet and very interesting for an average western tourist. At the boutique you are given the opportunity to purchase their exquisite jewellery at a discount price. I recommend visiting this place for experience, but give you a fair warning, if you don't buy anything - your significant other may eat your brain for some time after this visit hahah
review 4: What an amazing place.  Our guide Lisa walked us thru their process and you will certainly appreciate how much work and how many steps it take to make a piece of jewelry. Truly a craft.
review 5:
I went there without knowing the brand, just to visit the workshop and I must admit that the experience exceeded my expectations. Initially I was impressed with the kindness of the people who guided me in the shop, their continuous smile, their care and attention to my needs. I took some time to admire the amazing design of the shop which is blending so well with the nature around it. Combined with the interior design,
the products in the shop made me feel like I was walking in a jewelry museum, the unique designs are a proof of the talent and passion of the people working there.
Even though I loved the products in the shop, the tour of the workshop is what I appreciated the most, I would definitely recommend it if you have one hour to spare. The happiness of the people in the workshop, their enthusiasm, the joy of creating together something special was so visible. After walking around with my wonderful guide that explained every step of the creation process and understanding how much manual work and how many hands and hearts are touching every piece, I value even more the products that I bought. Thank you for the experience and see you soon!

name: Warung Semana
address: Jl. Raya Mambal Semana, Mambal, Kec. Abiansemal, Kabupaten Badung, Bali 80352, Indonesia
review 1:
So much flavour, friendly staff and stunning location. We came here everyday for a week while staying outside of Ubud. There are plenty of options of vegetarians at only 25k a plate, and a load of local Indonesian options in general. I cannot recommend the sayur urap enough - it‚Äôs beyond flavourful, and delicious to add with any other dish.
We ended up trying several items on the menu and my partner stresses that this is the best nasi campur that they have had in all of Bali.
review 2: A very cozy and beautiful view for dine in. There are so many place you can choose to enjoy your food. Indoor, outdoor, gazebo, etc. The food taste good. I recommend you to try the honey grilled chicken (ayam bakar madu). The dessert also good. I choose pisang coklat with strawberry ice cream. Good place, good service. I will be back soon ü•∞
review 3: Beautifull ambience and very cheap food, Also we found 3 4 vegetarian options!
review 4: Nice and cozy place to have lunch. Surrounded by rice field and greeneries. Implement physical distancing, open air with warm and helpful staff. The food was also good, tasty and cheap. Recommended.
review 5: Rustic Indonesian restaurant tucked in between rice fields. Delicious food.

name: Warung D'Carik
address: F64C+CW9, Jl. Raya Mambal Semana, Mambal, Kec. Abiansemal, Kabupaten Badung, Bali 80352, Indonesia
review 1:
They serve Balinese peanuts sauce and vegetables, water spinach and sprouts

Also various fruits sliced with spicy sauce RUJAK

place quite small also small parking lot not many table available

Food is tasty, huge portions, affordable price
But spicy alert !

Overall all is well
Also nice rice fields views
review 2: The location is easy to find because it is located on the side of the road and for parking it can be along the side of the road.  This stall sells special Balinese snacks such as rujak, plecing, tipat cantok etc, with a great display,, for the taste  from 1 to 10 i gave 7. The place is quite comfortable especially the one inside but needs to be cleaned again.
review 4: Great Balinese Traditional food. Try Plecing, Rujak Manis and Es Gula.

name: New Waroeng Tenggale
address: F63F+M2X, Jl. Raya Mambal Semana, Mambal, Kec. Abiansemal, Kabupaten Badung, Bali 80352, Indonesia
review 1:
A spacious restaurant with good food. The price is fine.

They really need to make the entrance becomes more welcoming, in the night looks like a door to a haunted house.

Over all, it was worth visit.
Love!
review 2:
I just stopped by to have dinner, knowing this place because I pass this place everyday.
They have spacious place and very nice rice paddy view. They have bean bag as well.
But the food was so so, nothing special.
One of the food was burnt, till my friend asked to change it. Just nothing  special for the food.
review 3: Brand new management and every saturday acoustic live music. The food is lovely and the view is amazing. Very nice an quiet place.
review 4: Absolutely lovely food and staff are super friendly. Such a peaceful environment. If you are in this area of Bali you must visit. They also serve halal food for those who are muslim.
review 5:
Love the view, I was there when it‚Äôs raining. But I still love the view. The food also comfortable. I tried the pasta and pizza tenggale, all good!üëçüèª
All of u must tryüëåüèª
